com.mygdx.game

Class Instructions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mygdx.game.Instructions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    public class Instructions
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    This class is responsible for displaying the instructions screen, which contains information regarding how to play the game, and what the game is about. The instructions screen can be accessed from the main menu, and contains five information screens that the user can scroll through using the on screen arrow buttons or by using their arrow keys located on their keyboard. A back button is located on the screen that takes the user back to the main menu screen.

    Instance Variables

    batch Instance of SpriteBatch used to render on screen elements

    game Instance of MainGame used to manage multiple game screens

    screen1Text Instance of Texture used to load image of screen 1

    screen2Text Instance of Texture used to load image of screen 2

    screen3Text Instance of Texture used to load image of screen 3

    screen4Text Instance of Texture used to load image of screen 4

    screen5Text Instance of Texture used to load image of screen 5

    nextText Instance of Texture used to load image of the next button

    prevText Instance of Texture used to load image of the previous button

    nextDarkText Instance of Texture used to load image of dark next button

    prevDarkText Instance of Texture used to load image of dark previous button

    backgroundText Instance of Texture used to load image of background

    backText Instance of Texture used to load back button

    backDarkText Instance of Texture used to load dark back button

    screen1Sprite Instance of Sprite used to create sprite of screen 1

    screen2Sprite Instance of Sprite used to create sprite of screen 2

    screen3Sprite Instance of Sprite used to create sprite of screen 3

    screen4Sprite Instance of Sprite used to create sprite of screen 4

    screen5Sprite Instance of Sprite used to create sprite of screen 5

    nextSprite Instance of Sprite used to create sprite of next button

    prevSprite Instance of Sprite used to create sprite of previous button

    nextDarkSprite Instance of Sprite used to create sprite of next dark button

    prevDarkSprite Instance of Sprite used to create sprite of previous dark button

    backgroundSprite Instance of Sprite used to create sprite of background image

    backSprite Instance of Sprite used to create a sprite of the back button

    backDarkSprite Instance of Sprite used to create a sprite of the dark back button

    nextRect Instance of Rectangle used to detect button click of next button

    prevRect Instance of Rectangle used to detect button click of previous button

    backRect Instance of Rectangle used to detect button click of back button

    pageNum int representing current page number of highscore screen

    leftKey boolean true/false based on if left key was pressed

    rightKey boolean true/false based on if right key was pressed

    escKey boolean true/false based on if escape key was pressed

    screenList Sprite array used to scroll between pages

    Version:
    4 07/06/2016
    Author:
    Brian Tran

        batch - SpriteBatch used to render on-screen elements
        game - MainGame used to switch and manage screens

    • Method Detail

      • show

        public void show()
        The show method is an overridden method from the Screen interface that gets run once at the beginning of the class execution. It is used to initialize variables, and set preferences to sprites and other on screen elements.
        Specified by:
        show in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        The render method is an overridden method from the Screen interface. The render method runs once every frame, refreshing the screen and its elements. The render method is mostly used to draw onscreen elements with the SpriteBatch. The first if statement is used to set the leftKey boolean to true if the left arrow key has been pressed. The second if statement is used to set the rightKey boolean to true if the right key has been pressed. The third if statement is used to set the escKey boolean to true if the escape key has been pressed. The fourth if statement is used to determine what happens if the user's cursor hovers over the next button. The fifth if statement determines what happens if the user has clicked the mouse button while hovering over the button or if the user has clicked the right arrow key. The sixth if statement determines if the current page number is at the maximum allowed pages. If it is, page number is set to minimum page number to allow for looping. Otherwise, page number increments by one. The seventh if statement is used to determine what happens if the user's cursor hovers over the previous button. The eighth if statement is used to determine what will happen if the user has clicked the mouse while the cursor is over the button, or if the user has pressed the left arrow key. The ninth if statement is used to determine if the current page number is at its minimum. If it is, the page number is set to its maximum value to allow for looping. Otherwise, the page number decrements by one. The tenth if statement is used to determine what happens when the user hovers their cursor over the back button. The eleventh if statement is used to determine change the screen to the main menu if the user clicks the mouse button while the cursor is hovered over the back button. The twelfth if statement is used to close the game when the user presses the CTRL + W shortcut.
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

      • resize

        public void resize(int width,
                   int height)

      • hide

        public void hide()
        The hide method is an overridden method from the Screen interface that runs every time the screen is switched off of the current one. The dispose method is called so that the screen properly disposes of itself once done with.
        Specified by:
        hide in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        The dispose method is an overridden method that is used to dispose of all of the resources once this screen has been destroyed. This allows for more free system memory.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
